pe_description: The Automobiles & Components sub-sector in Indonesia has a P/E ratio of 7.26, lower than the average IDX P/E ratio. This sub-sector's P/E ratio has declined compared to last year, ranking 9th among other sub-sectors in the Indonesian market. Out of the companies in this sub-sector, four outperform the average P/E ratio: '###Gajah Tunggal Tbk####', '###Indospring Tbk####', and '###Multi Prima Sejahtera Tbk####'. '###Multistrada Arah Sarana Tbk####', on the other hand, is considered overvalued based on its P/E ratio. Factors influencing growth within this sub-sector include government policies, technological advancements, consumer preferences, and competition from both domestic and international players.
health_description: The Automobiles & Components sub-sector's recent performance has been lackluster, with an average price change below the IDX average. New listings have been scarce, with the last one occurring in September 2023. This suggests that there may be barriers to entry in this sub-sector. Only 4 out of 17 companies experienced positive price changes in the last 30 days. Factors that could affect the sub-sector's health index include government regulations, technological advancements, and changes in consumer preferences. The Indonesian government body responsible for regulating the Automobiles & Components sub-sector is the Ministry of Industry.
growth_description: The Automobiles & Components sub-sector in Indonesia has experienced significant growth in the past year, with an average YoY quarter earnings change of 89.62% and an average YoY quarter revenue change of 18.36%. This growth has placed the sub-sector at 7th and 10th place in terms of earnings rank and revenue rank, respectively, compared to other sub-sectors. Within the sub-sector, ###Gajah Tunggal Tbk####, ###PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk####, and ###Selamat Sempurna Tbk#### stand out as the companies with the highest YoY earning growth, YoY revenue growth, and net profit margin, respectively. However, it is important to note that the growth of the Automobiles & Components sub-sector can be affected by various conditions, such as changes in government regulations, shifts in consumer preferences, and fluctuations in the global automotive market.
